name: Alec Ross Fenichel
objective: Obtain an internship position offering mechanical, electrical, and/or programming experience for Summer 2016.

detail: Worked on small team to develop prototype of future cockpit for automated vehicles and tested in dynamic simulator
Developed GUI for researchers to monitor and control all electrical and computer systems via UDP using MATLAB
Created custom PCB board and software systems for recording feedback with force sensitive resistors using C
Created electrical and software systems for controlling linear actuator with pulse wide modulation using C
Developed object-oriented Arduino library for fast access to I/O pins with port manipulation using C++
Developed internal website using Drupal CMS for managing users and internal documents
Integrated user management system with Georgia Tech’s LDAP database and CAS login servers
Diagnosed and resolved technical issues related to hardware and software
Developed automated system for sharing documents with external clients using HTML, JavaScript, PHP, and batch
Developed new website using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP
Placed in IEEE SoutheastCon Website Competition every year – 1st Place (2014), 1st Place (2013), 3rd Place (2012)
Developed software for first dual core jet engine controller SCADE qualified C code generator
Created automated tool for gathering and analyzing licensing server data using Perl, VBA, and batch
Created project tracking system to quickly identify problematic deadlines using VBA
Designed object detection system for competition robot using infrared, ultrasonic, and tactile sensors
Programmed movement algorithms for advanced line following using BASIC and C
Worked to facilitate and develop a community environment within freshmen residence halls
Mentored new students in their transition to college life at Georgia Tech
Managed finances for Folk and Caldwell residence halls
